News.Title: Solex Energy jumps 6% on ₹276 cr solar order win
News.Summary: Solex Energy secured a ₹276 crore order for high-efficiency TOPCon solar PV modules from a domestic power producer, boosting stock 6% and strengthening order book visibility through May 2026.

News.Title: Solex Energy secures ₹276 cr solar module order
News.Summary: Solex Energy Limited bags major ₹276 crore order from domestic IPP for N-type TOPCon solar PV modules, scheduled for execution between February-May 2026, boosting order book visibility.

News.Title: Solex Energy Wins ₹276 Crore Order Contract
News.Summary: Solex Energy has successfully secured a significant order worth ₹276 crores, marking a major business development for the renewable energy company and strengthening its order book position.

News.Title: Solex Energy Plans 400% Revenue Growth by FY27
News.Summary: Solex Energy outlines ambitious growth roadmap to scale revenues from ₹662.20 crore to ₹3,300.00 crore by FY27, driven by capacity expansion and backward integration in India's solar sector.

News.Title: Solex Energy Partners With Malaysia's TT Vision
News.Summary: Solex Energy announces collaboration with Malaysia's TT Vision to enhance solar automation and talent development in India's renewable energy sector.

News.Title: Solex Energy Reports Mixed Q2 Results with Revenue Growth but Lower Profit
News.Summary: Solex Energy reported quarterly consolidated net profit of 52 million rupees, down from 91 million rupees in the same period last year. The company's revenue increased to 1.55 billion rupees from 1.3 billion rupees year-over-year. EBITDA rose to 186 million rupees compared to 143 million rupees previously, with EBITDA margin improving to 12% from 10.87%.

News.Title: Solex Energy Plans Rs 1,500 Crore Fundraise to Expand Solar Manufacturing Capacity
News.Summary: Solex Energy plans to raise Rs 500 crore through a qualified institutional placement (QIP) and Rs 1,000 crore in debt to fund expansion projects. The company, which recently migrated to NSE's main board and has a market capitalization of Rs 1,600 crore, aims to complete the equity raise within three months. A State Bank of India-led consortium has agreed to finance the debt component. The Rs 1,400 crore investment will establish a 2.2 GW solar cell manufacturing facility costing Rs 1,200 crore, targeted for completion by March 2027, and expand module capacity by 2.5 GW for Rs 200 crore. Solex currently operates 4 GW of module manufacturing capacity and plans to scale up to 10 GW each of module and cell capacity by 2030, with total planned investment of $1.5 billion.

News.Title: Solex Energy Partners With German Research Institute, Launches India's First Rear Contact Solar Module
News.Summary: Solex Energy has formed a partnership with Germany's ISC Konstanz for advanced solar research. The company launched India's first rear contact solar module called Tapi TRC. Solex Energy plans to invest $1.5 billion and aims to build a workforce of 25,000 employees by 2030.

News.Title: Solex Energy Secures ₹544.62 Crore Solar PV Module Order from Zelestra Group
News.Summary: Solex Energy has received a work order worth ₹544.62 crore from Zelestra Group for solar PV modules. The project is scheduled for completion in two phases, with deadlines set for February 2026 and November 2026.

News.Title: Solex Energy Reports 52% Revenue Growth, Moves to NSE Main Board
News.Summary: Solex Energy reported operational revenue of ₹415 crore for H1 FY26, marking a 52% increase from the previous year. The company successfully transitioned to the NSE Main Board and has set a target to achieve 10 GW solar module production capacity by 2030.

News.Title: Solex Energy Transitions to NSE Main Board, Achieves 800 MW Production Capacity
News.Summary: Solex Energy celebrated its transition to the NSE Main Board with a bell ringing ceremony in Surat. The company's Tadkeshwar facility has reached commercial production capacity of 800 MW. Solex Energy plans to expand to 2.5 GW capacity by Diwali 2025 and targets achieving 10 GW capacity by 2030.

News.Title: Solex Energy Receives Approval to Migrate from NSE Emerge to Main Board
News.Summary: Solex Energy has received approval to move its equity shares from NSE Emerge platform to the main board of the National Stock Exchange (NSE). This migration represents a transition from the SME platform to the main exchange board for the company's listed shares.

News.Title: Solex Energy Secures 4.51 Billion Rupee Order for Solar Modules
News.Summary: Solex Energy has received a significant order worth 4.51 billion rupees from KPI Green Energy. The order is for the supply of 310 MW of solar modules, indicating a substantial deal in the renewable energy sector.

News.Title: Solex Energy Secures Major Order Worth 4.51 Billion Rupees
News.Summary: Solex Energy has received a significant order valued at 4.51 billion rupees (approximately $54.5 million USD). This order represents a substantial business opportunity for the company and could potentially impact its financial performance positively.

News.Title: Solex Energy Secures Major Order Worth 4.51 Billion Rupees
News.Summary: Solex Energy has received a significant order valued at 4.51 billion rupees. This represents a substantial business opportunity for the company and could potentially impact its financial performance positively.

News.Title: Solex Energy Expands Module Manufacturing Capacity with Rs 2 Billion Investment
News.Summary: Solex Energy has increased its solar module manufacturing capacity to 2.2 GW with a significant investment of Rs 2 billion. This expansion represents a substantial growth in the company's production capabilities, potentially positioning it for increased market share in the solar energy sector.

News.Title: Solex Energy Commissions Advanced 800 MW Manufacturing Line for N-type Topcon Modules
News.Summary: Solex Energy has announced the commissioning of a new high-speed manufacturing line with an 800 MW capacity. This advanced production line is designed to manufacture modules based on N-type Topcon rectangular cells, representing a significant upgrade in the company's manufacturing capabilities.

News.Title: Solex Energy Commissions Advanced 800 MW Manufacturing Line
News.Summary: Solex Energy has announced the commissioning of an advanced 800 MW high-speed manufacturing line. This new line is capable of producing modules based on N-type TopCon rectangular cells, representing a significant upgrade in the company's production capabilities.

News.Title: Solex Energy Reports 103% Revenue Growth and Plans Production Expansion
News.Summary: Solex Energy has announced a significant 103% revenue growth for the year. The company is also planning a production expansion, which is expected to boost both revenue and profitability starting from the fiscal year 2026 (FY26).

News.Title: Solex Energy Reports Strong Revenue Growth and Expansion Plans
News.Summary: Solex Energy has achieved a significant 103% revenue growth during the year. The company is planning a production expansion, which is expected to boost both revenue and profitability starting from the fiscal year 2026 (FY26).

News.Title: Solex Energy Secures 29 Crore Rupee Order for Solar PV Modules
News.Summary: Solex Energy Limited has won a significant order valued at 29 crore rupees for solar photovoltaic (PV) modules. This development indicates a positive business opportunity for the company in the renewable energy sector.

News.Title: Solex Energy Secures 76.7M Rupee Maintenance Contract for Solar Street Lights
News.Summary: Solex Energy has been awarded a contract worth 76.7 million rupees for a Comprehensive Maintenance Contract (CMS) spanning 5 years. The contract includes the implementation of a Remote Monitoring System (RMS) for smart solar street light systems.

News.Title: Solex Energy: Launches Innovative Solar Module to Boost Power Output by 7%
News.Summary: Solex Energy introduces India's first rectangular cell-based solar module using N-type TOPcon technology, aiming to increase solar power output by over 7%. The company plans to invest ₹6,000 crore by 2030 to expand into solar cell manufacturing, targeting 5 GW capacity. Solex also aims to increase its module manufacturing capacity from 1.5 GW to 15 GW and expand its workforce to over 25,000.
